titleStmt.title: A. O. Casley et al. to Unknown
CWG2870

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p: The undersighned would respectfully pesent to his excellency the Govenor of Kentucky the name of Luciaus D Lillle of McLean as a suitable person to fill the office of Commonwealth attorny in the 14th Judicial which is about to be formed and which includes the County in which he risides Mr Lillle is a democrat and possesses all the necessary qualifications to enable him to discharge the duties of office He is a young man of sober moral and studious habits, and strugleing as he is to come up from obscruity diseres in our opinion encouragement

A. C. Casley
B J Shaver
W. S. Darnaby
Q. C. Wickliffe
J. H. Johnson
Jas E. Gibson
Tho P Porter
J A Prall
S H Boles
S E S Maney
C J Walton
S. H. Jenkins
A. P. Graves
B C Cissell
W B Read
R E Glenn
James R Barrick
